text: Ndam, also known as Dam or Ndamm, is an East Chadic language spoken by around 6,500 people in southwestern Chad. It is spoken mainly in the Tandjil√© and Lai Prefectures. There are two dialects of the language: Ndam Dik (northern), and Ndam-Ndam (southern). == References == Category:East Chadic languages Category:Languages of Chad
title: Ndam language
